p: On the S region, a significant ( P < .05) pervasive episodic selection was found in two different sites (536th and 644th nucleotide position using the reference sequence; the Wuhan seafood market pneumonia virus isolate labeled Wuhan‐Hu‐1 MN908947.3). For the sequences in clade II, on the 536th aminoacidic position in the Wuhan coronavirus sequence, there is an asparagine residue instead of an aspartic acid residue, whereas, on the 644th aminoacidic position in Wuhan coronavirus sequence, there is a threonine residue instead of an alanine residue. A significant ( P < .05) pervasive negative selection in 1065 sites (87%) has been evidenced and confirmed by FUBAR analysis, suggesting that the S region could be highly conserved.
